page.title: 03CATERHAM HIGH STREET PAGE 1
page.content: Just beyond the{HIGH STREET}in Town End is the oldest house in Caterham, said to have been built in 1640. It is called{TOWN END FARM}and is built with flints. This house was the first Catholic school in Caterham. Part of Caterham's first Board school can still be seen as part of the Remedial Centre at the corner of Chaldon Rd. The bricks of the old building are smaller. Next to the old school is an old{FIRE STATION.}Hillcroft First school have the{BELL}from its tower. Cart-horses from the fields opposite were used to pull the fire engine. The chemist and greengrocer's next door were once soldiers' homes. The white painted solicitor's house on the opposite side of the road was built in the 17th century. Opposite the Blacksmiths Arms is a white building with an archway.
